newsitem.title: GERMANY: RWE Telliance gets nationwide licence.
newsitem.headline: RWE Telliance gets nationwide licence.

text.p: The German post ministry said it granted RWE Telliance AG a nationwide licence to provide telecommunications services.

It also granted two regional licences to Frankfurt-based MFS Deutschland GmbH and Darmstadt-based Heag MediaNet GmbH to run transmission networks for telecommunications services, the ministry said late on Thursday.
The ministry said it had now granted a total of 10 licences for private competitors to state-owned telecommunications company Deutsche Telekom AG since licencing began on October 15.
Telekom is due to be partially privatised in Germany's biggest ever share flotation on November 18.
Two of the licences granted so far are nationwide. On October 15 the ministry granted a nationwide licence to Vebacom GmbH.
The post ministry said the licences marked a further decisive step towards the creation of functioning competition at the network level.
It said it would issue further licences for the running of local, regional and nationwide network systems.
The licence for MFS covers Berlin, Duesseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Cologne, Munich and Stuttgart, the ministry said. The licence for Heag covers the region of southern Hesse.
